comment.author: 55597723@N02
comment._content: Great Classic Photo. Nicely Taken. Nice Place.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The boathouse on the far bank is that of the Waterford Boat Club whose well endowed Blue Riband winners of 1906(?) that you featured earlier were based.    The Suir at that point is tidal with a very strong downwards flow and especially when the tide is ebbing and so those wonderful men trained and prepared under very difficult circumstances on a very lively river.  All the more credit is due to them for that!  The Limerick Steamship Company were alive and active throughout my youth and I knew families who had been with them for many years, it's good to see them get a mention.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] They were photographed circa 1897, and were well endowed with prizes alright! ;) And we have another Waterford Boat Club group that was taken on 18 May 1906...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
